prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Tapered Top and Bottom Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. Set the euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector as [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Now, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane (face_1) of the coordinate system. Step 3: Create loops For this sketch, we will create one loop with 4 line segments: 1. line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0], facing right 2. line_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5], facing up 3. line_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5], facing left 4. line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0], facing down Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch The loop defines a 2D shape of a rectangular extrusion. Extrude it by 0.25 units towards the normal (Z+). Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the whole sketch. Perform a NewBodyFeatureOperation to obtain part_1. Part 2: Three-dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system for part 2. Set the euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector as [0.2348, 0.25, 0.0]. Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch Now, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane (face_1) of the coordinate system. Step 3: Create loops For this sketch, we will create one loop with 4 line segments: 1. line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0], facing right 2. line_2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.5], facing up 3. line_3: Start Point [0.25, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5], facing left 4. line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0], facing down Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch The loop defines a 2D shape of a rectangular extrusion. Extrude it by 0.0 units towards the normal (Z+) and by 0.25 units in the opposite direction (Z-). Apply a scaling factor of 0.5 to the whole sketch. Perform a JoinFeatureOperation to combine it with part_1. This will create the final_shape. Congratulations! You've successfully constructed the final_shape based on the given CAD Assembly JSON.</description>
